formattedAddress: 301 Park Ave, New York, NY 10022, USA
adrFormatAddress: 301 Park Ave, New York, NY 10022, USA

editorialSummary.text: Luxe 1931 art deco landmark featuring refined quarters, a renowned spa & high-end dining.

originalText.text: I've stayed in a penthouse in The Residences which had an extensive entertaining/living area with a small terrace. The bed was the highlight of the stay, very comfortable as is WA standard. The living areas could do with a bit of a design update from the 80's hotel chic that was all the rage then. Still, nothing to complain about with this hotel.

text.text: I've stayed in a penthouse in The Residences which had an extensive entertaining/living area with a small terrace. The bed was the highlight of the stay, very comfortable as is WA standard. The living areas could do with a bit of a design update from the 80's hotel chic that was all the rage then. Still, nothing to complain about with this hotel.

originalText.text: I had a wonderful experience at the Waldorf Astoria in New York. The luxurious ambiance, impeccable service, and historic charm made my stay memorable. The only minor downside was the windows not being perfectly clean, likely due to the building's location by the street. However, this did not significantly detract from the overall positive impression. I would still highly recommend the Waldorf Astoria for an indulgent and elegant stay in the heart of the city.

originalText.text: This is a wonderful location close to Central Park in New York. The restaurant is packed with great dishes such as tasty Salmon, the yummy Waldorf salad and others. I live in New York and went there to handle some business matter. This is the perfect place to stay. I enjoy it very much.

text.text: This is a wonderful location close to Central Park in New York. The restaurant is packed with great dishes such as tasty Salmon, the yummy Waldorf salad and others. I live in New York and went there to handle some business matter. This is the perfect place to stay. I enjoy it very much.

originalText.text: Great place to stay. Lovely staff and lots of places close by. The location is great. I genuinely thought it was a 5 star hotel and was surprised its rated only 4 stars on hotel portals definitely punched above its weight. Highly recommended. Loved the iconic Waldorf salad. But Eddy Murphy and James Earl Jones didn't return my call...

text.text: Great place to stay. Lovely staff and lots of places close by. The location is great. I genuinely thought it was a 5 star hotel and was surprised its rated only 4 stars on hotel portals definitely punched above its weight. Highly recommended. Loved the iconic Waldorf salad. But Eddy Murphy and James Earl Jones didn't return my call...

originalText.text: Beautiful hotel and Peacock Alley restaurant gorgeous as well. But the service we expected from a place like this was very disappointing. Ordered a drink and didn't receive it until I complained. Waiter rarely checked on us. It takes a lot for me to complain but this was bad enough. When I complained the reaction from the staff was even more disappointing.  I was told (with an attitude) from all 3 ladies at the front that service was poor because they were understaffed and too busy. One even told me it was the bars fault not the waiter that i didnt get the $30 drink i ordered. This was at 2pm on a Saturday and there were many empty tables and adequate waiters. Manager then comes over and gives the same busy excuse but not an apology. He comes back later to comp my drink for the poor service. For a place that advertises as "A signature in Waldorf Astoria hotels across the globe, Peacock Alley remains the place “to see and be seen” just as it was all those years ago for Manhattan’s high society." This is a big miss. I'm a regular at Capital Grille and expected the same level of service. But this place missed the mark badly on the service aspect.
